conclusion: Determine initial acceleration of block A when pulled by force F until block B just leaves the ground.
Two blocks A and B connected by a spring, block B on the ground.
Analyze forces on blocks using Newton's second law.
Force F applied upwards on block A, gravity acts on both blocks, spring force acts between them.
For block A: Upward force F, downward gravity mg, upward spring force F_spring.
For block B: Downward gravity mg, normal force N, downward spring force -F_spring.
When block B leaves ground, N = 0, so mg + F_spring = 0, thus F_spring = -mg.
Using Hooke's Law, F_spring = kx, so -mg = -kx, thus x = mg/k.
Substitute F_spring = -mg into equation for block A: F - mg = ma, leading to F - 2mg = ma.
The initial acceleration of block A is (F - 2mg)/m.
